intro: Roettlera brevipes, commonly known as the short-stemmed roettlera, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically produces vibrant red or orange blooms that attract pollinators such as birds and insects. Roettlera brevipes thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Its unique morphology and ornamental value make it a popular choice for cultivation in botanical gardens and private collections.
